definition: to show off one's abilities/to exhibit one's skills
dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
surname Lu
to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.chinese: 讓我給你露一手，開開眼。

sentences.english: The tunes he composed gave each member a chance to shine.
sentences.chinese: 他所作的曲調讓樂團中的每位成員都有機會露一手。

sentences.english: I like joining every battle for a haggle.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡參與殺價買賣露一手。

sentences.english: Scott knew that he would do it.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特就知道自己可以露一手。

sentences.english: We'll kick some ass this afternoon at the match.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午的比賽我們一定要好好露一手。

sentences.english: I'm going to show off my skills today.
sentences.chinese: 今天我大牛要給大家露一手啦。

sentences.english: Okay, I'm going to show you now.

definition: cooking skills/culinary talent
(idiom) fully displaying one's capabilities
specialty (dish)
to go to the kitchen (to prepare a meal)/to cook
to make a fool of oneself
(coll.) to show off
specialty/unique skill
to cook
to hold a welcoming dinner or reception
to be in charge of the cooking/to be the chef/head cook/chef
to eat one's fill/to have a good meal
display of severity immediately on taking office/(fig.) initial show of strength
to prepare meals/chef
to act in a supporting role/fig. to play second fiddle
lit. presenting the Buddha with borrowed flowers (idiom); fig. to win favor or influence using sb else's property/plagiarism
to lose face
